subject: Psychology
title: The Paradox of Choice
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Paradox of Choice.

hook.text: A store offers 24 jam flavors. Another offers 6. The store with fewer options sells ten times more.

buildup.text: Barry Schwartz showed that too many choices overwhelm us, leading to anxiety and decision paralysis.

discovery.text: More options increase the chance of regret. With 24 jams, you always wonder if you picked the wrong one.

twist.text: Some researchers argue the effect is overstated. Context matters â€” experts want more options, novices want fewer.

climax.text: The sweet spot exists between too few options and too many. Enough to feel free, not so many you freeze.

punchline.text: More choices don't make you happier. They make you stuck.

quiz.question: What did the famous jam study demonstrate?
options: Fewer options led to more purchases
Choice has no effect on buying behavior
